info.title: DUST API Documentation
info.description: The OpenAPI specification for the Dust.tt API

get.description: Get the agent configurations for the workspace identified by {wId}.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

405.description: Method not supported. Only GET is expected.

get.description: Retrieve the agent configuration identified by {sId} in the workspace identified by {wId}.

400.description: Bad Request. Invalid or missing parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

405.description: Method not supported. Only GET or PATCH is expected.

patch.description: Update the agent configuration identified by {sId} in the workspace identified by {wId}.

400.description: Bad Request. Invalid or missing parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

405.description: Method not supported. Only GET or PATCH is expected.

get.description: Search for agent configurations by name in the workspace identified by {wId}.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search query for agent configuration names

400.description: Bad Request. Invalid or missing parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

405.description: Method not supported. Only GET is expected.

post.summary: Cancel message generation in a conversation

messageIds.description: List of message IDs to cancel generation for

success.description: Indicates if the cancellation was successful

400.description: Invalid request (invalid query parameters or request body)

post.description: Create a new content fragment in the workspace identified by {wId}.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

get.summary: Get the events for a conversation
get.description: Get the events for a conversation in the workspace identified by {wId}.

200.description: Events for the conversation, view the "Events" page from this documentation for more information.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

405.description: Method not supported. Only GET is expected.

get.description: Get a conversation in the workspace identified by {wId}.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

405.description: Method not supported. Only GET is expected.

post.summary: Edit an existing message in a conversation

mentions.description: List of agent mentions in the message

configurationId.description: ID of the mentioned agent configuration

agentMessages.description: Optional array of agent messages generated in response

400.description: Invalid request (message not found or not a user message)

get.description: Get events for a message in the workspace identified by {wId}.

parameters.name: lastEventId
parameters.description: ID of the last event received

400.description: Bad Request

401.description: Unauthorized

post.description: Create a message in the workspace identified by {wId} in the conversation identified by {cId}.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

post.description: Create a new conversation in the workspace identified by {wId}.

contentFragments.description: The list of content fragments to attach to this conversation (optional)

blocking.description: Whether to wait for the agent to generate the initial message (if blocking = false, you will need to use streaming events to get the messages)

visibility.description: The visibility of the conversation (The API only accepts `unlisted`)

400.description: Bad Request

401.description: Unauthorized

fileSize.description: Size of the file in bytes

useCase.description: Intended use case for the file, use "conversation"

useCaseMetadata.description: (optional) Metadata for the use case, for conversation useCase should be dictionary with conversationId stringified

400.description: Invalid request or unsupported file type

401.description: Unauthorized

get.description: Retrieve a run for an app in the space identified by {spaceId}.

parameters.name: wId
parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

post.description: Create and execute a run for an app in the space specified by {spaceId}.

parameters.name: wId
parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

specification_hash.description: Hash of the app specification. Ensures API compatibility across app iterations.

inputs.description: Array of input objects for the app

stream.description: If true, the response will be streamed

blocking.description: If true, the request will block until the run is complete

block_filter.description: Array of block names to filter the response

200.description: App run created and executed successfully

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

get.description: Get all apps in the space identified by {spaceId}.

parameters.name: wId
parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

sId.description: Unique string identifier for the app

savedRun.description: Saved run identifier of the app

dustAPIProjectId.description: ID of the associated Dust API project

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

400.description: Invalid request body

403.description: Unauthorized - Only admins or builders can administrate spaces

500.description: Internal server error - The data source view cannot be updated

401.description: Unauthorized - The data source view is in use and cannot be deleted

403.description: Forbidden - Only admins or builders can delete data source views

get.description: Search the data source view identified by {dsvId} in the workspace identified by {wId}.

parameters.name: dsvId
parameters.description: ID of the data source view

parameters.name: top_k
parameters.description: The number of results to return

parameters.name: full_text
parameters.description: Whether to return the full document content

parameters.name: target_document_tokens
parameters.description: The number of tokens in the target document

400.description: Invalid request error

get.description: Retrieves a list of data source views for the specified space

parameters.name: wId
parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

200.description: List of data source views in the space

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

get.summary: Retrieve a document from a data source
get.description: Retrieve a document from a data source identified by {dsId} in the workspace identified by {wId}.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

404.description: Data source or document not found.

post.summary: Upsert a document in a data source
post.description: Upsert a document in a data source in the workspace identified by {wId}.

text.description: The text content of the document to upsert.

section.description: The structured content of the document to upsert.

source_url.description: The source URL for the document to upsert.

tags.description: Tags to associate with the document.

parents.description: Parent document IDs to associate with the document.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) for the document (e.g. 1698225000). Can be null or omitted.

light_document_output.description: If true, a lightweight version of the document will be returned in the response (excluding the text, chunks and vectors). Defaults to false.

async.description: If true, the upsert operation will be performed asynchronously.

upsert_context.description: Additional context for the upsert operation.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

403.description: Forbidden. The data source is managed.

404.description: Data source or document not found.

delete.summary: Delete a document from a data source
delete.description: Delete a document from a data source in the workspace identified by {wId}.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

403.description: Forbidden. The data source is managed.

404.description: Data source or document not found.

post.description: Update the parents of a document in the data source identified by {dsId} in the workspace identified by {wId}.

parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

404.description: Data source or workspace not found.

get.description: Get data sources in the workspace identified by {wId}.
Retrieves a list of spaces for the authenticated workspace.

parameters.name: wId
parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

400.description: Bad Request. Missing or invalid parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

get.description: Get usage data for the workspace identified by {wId} in CSV format.

parameters.name: wId
parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date in YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD format

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date in YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD format (required when mode is 'range')

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The mode of date range selection ('month' or 'range')

parameters.name: table
parameters.description:
The name of the usage table to retrieve:
- "users": The list of users categorized by their activity level.
- "assistant_messages": The list of messages sent by users including the mentioned assistants.
- "builders": The list of builders categorized by their activity level.
- "assistants": The list of workspace assistants and their corresponding usage.
- "all": A concatenation of all the above tables.

200.description: The usage data in CSV format or a ZIP of multiple CSVs if table is equal to "all"

400.description: Invalid request query

403.description: The workspace does not have access to the usage data API

BearerAuth.description: Your DUST API key is a Bearer token.

sId.description: Unique string identifier for the user

provider.description: Authentication provider used by the user

image.description: URL of the user's profile image

sId.description: Unique string identifier for the workspace

items.description: Feature flags enabled for the workspace

defaultEmbeddingProvider.description: Default provider for embeddings in the workspace

fullName.description: User's full name in the current context

email.description: User's email in the current context

profilePictureUrl.description: URL of the user's profile picture

origin.description: Origin of the context (contact us to add more at support@dust.tt)

sId.description: Unique string identifier for the agent configuration

versionCreatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the version was created

versionAuthorId.description: ID of the user who created this version

description.example: An AI agent designed to handle customer support inquiries

instructions.example: Always greet the customer politely and try to resolve their issue efficiently.

status.description: Current status of the agent configuration

userFavorite.description: Status of the user favorite for this configuration

templateId.description: ID of the template used for this configuration

sId.description: Unique string identifier for the conversation
Unique string identifier for the message

content.example: Hello, I need help with my order.

chainOfThought.description: Chain of thought for the message
chainOfThought.example: The user is asking about their order. I should first greet them and then ask for their order number.

content.example: Hello! I'd be happy to help you with your order. Could you please provide your order number?

configurationId.description: ID of the mentioned agent configuration

title.description: The title of the content fragment

content.description: The content of the content fragment
content.example: This is my content fragment extracted text

url.description: The URL of the content fragment

contentType.description: The content type of the content fragment

fileId.description: The id of the previously uploaded file

sId.description: Unique string identifier for the space

groupIds.description: List of group IDs that have access to the space

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the datasource was created

description.example: Contains all customer-related information and FAQs

dustAPIProjectId.description: ID of the associated Dust API project

connectorId.description: ID of the connector used for this datasource

assistantDefaultSelected.description: Whether this datasource is selected by default for assistants

category.description: The category of the data source view

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the data source view was created

editedByUser.description: The user who last edited the data source view

editedAt.description: Timestamp of when the data source view was last edited by the user

id.description: Unique identifier for the data source view

kind.description: The kind of the data source view

parentsIn.description: List of IDs included in this view, null if complete data source is taken

sId.description: Unique string identifier for the data source view

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the data source view was last updated

spaceId.description: ID of the space containing the data source view

specification_hash.description: The hash of the app specification

example.text: This is the first chunk of the document.
This is the second chunk of the document.

text.example: This is the full text content of the document. It contains multiple paragraphs and covers various topics related to customer support.
